So, I've been thinking about the recent return of space sims, like Star Citizen, Elite Dangerous and to a lesser extent KSP itself, and I've been thinking about the old Wing Commander series. I never played them, being way before my time, but I did fall in love with one of Roberts' later games, Freelancer.

Anyway, should I check out the old Wing Commander games, or have they been truly surpassed by later games?

They definitely have aged, but are worth checking out if you can get past the graphics. Also, Descent: Freespace 1 and (especially) 2 are a must if you haven't played them. Descent 2 still has an active community that has done wonders to update it's graphics.

Oh god here come the nostalgia flash backs!

Descent was just plan awesome, I think I still have Descent 3 on my gaming drive... yep I do, I loaded it up a few years ago for the epic funs, not very many zero gee 1st person shooters but those are my personal fav.
